intro: Cupania andronensis, commonly known as the Andronese cupuaçu, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon basin. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains edible seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and local cuisine. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various wildlife species.
